description:
Love is unusual for Koizumi Risa and Ootani Atsushi, who are both striving to find their ideal partner in high school—172 cm tall Koizumi is much taller than the average girl, and Ootani is much shorter than the average guy at 156 cm. To add to their plights, their crushes fall in love with each other, leaving Koizumi and Ootani comically flustered and heartbroken. To make matters worse, they're even labeled as a comedy duo by their homeroom teacher due to their personalities and the stark difference in their heights, and their classmates even think of their arguments as sketches.

Lovely★Complex follows Koizumi and Ootani as they encourage each other in finding love and become close friends. Apart from their ridiculous antics, they soon find out an unexpected similarity in their music and fashion tastes. Maybe they possess a chemistry yet unknown, but could love ever bloom between the mismatched pair?

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Netorare
tags.description: Netorare is what happens when the protagonist gets their partner stolen from them by someone else. It is a sexual fetish designed to cause sexual jealousy by way of having the partner indulge in sexual activity with someone other than the protagonist.

tags.name: Basketball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of basketball.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Femboy
tags.description: Features a boy who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of girls.

node.description: __Zodiac__: Leo Twitter She loves to read manga. Worked in a restaurant kitchen before she became a mangaka. Hates all raw foods, excluding raw eggs. Loves egg rice. Always loved stand-up comedy and used to listen to tapes of comedy acts, especially Downtown, on her way to and from school every day. The only time she has any energy is when she goes to concerts. Loves bands like Tamio Okuda, Bump of Chicken, and Tokyo Ska Paradise Orchestra. (Source: mangaka's notes Volume 3 of Love Com) Aya Nakahara won the 2003 Shogakukan manga award for her breakthrough hit Love★Com which was made into a major motion picture and a PS2 game in 2006. She debuted with Haru to Kuuki Nichiyo-bi in 1995, and her other works include HANADA and Himitsu Kichi. (VIZ author bio)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/伊藤郁子)

Known for her work as a character designer on [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) and [Princess Tutu](https://anilist.co/anime/721/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
Previously working at Tavac, now for Real-T.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hironostation?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Eserp%7Ctwgr%5Eauthor) | [Website](http://hironosuke.chu.jp/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hironosukesato/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/hironosukesato)

Hironosuke Sato is a Japanese composer and pianist,arranger, keyboardist. He graduated from Berklee College of Music in Massachusetts. 
He participated in anime as an arranger and keyboardist, but also in numerous concerts with SCANDAL, Yui Makino...

(Source: Wikipedia, translated)

A nine-member Japanese boy band under the talent agency Johnny & Associates. The group is split into two sub-groups: Hey! Say! 7 (which composed of the younger members) and Hey! Say! BEST (the older members). 

Hey! Say! JUMP originally debuted with ten members, the largest group in Johnny's history. But in 2011, Ryutaro Morimoto was indefinitely suspended from the group following an underage smoking scandal. Hey! Say! JUMP is considered an expansion of the temporary group Hey! Say! 7. The name Hey! Say! refers to the fact that all the members were born in the Heisei period and JUMP is an acronym for Johnny's Ultra Music Power. 

(Source: Wikipedia)
A Japanese animator, character designer, animation supervisor and animation director. He is widely known for his range of character designs for the one piece seasons 1-11.

Tegomass (テゴマス) was at first a temporary unit intended to help promote Johnny's Entertainment internationally. The group is composed of Tegoshi Yuya and Masuda Takahisa of the group NEWS. The group's name comes from the start of each member's last names.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/福冨博) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hiroshi_Fukutomi)

Originating from [Shin-Ei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/247/)

Married to animator [Kazuko Fukutomi](https://anilist.co/staff/157057/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/oja0222digi)

Affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/) since 1987.

[Seki-sensei](https://anilist.co/character/14098/) in [Ojamajo Doremi](https://anilist.co/anime/350/) is named after her.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/@tanusuke45) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kōnosuke_Uda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/宇田鋼之介)

He graduated from the Animation Department of Tokyo Design Academy and worked as a freelancer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). He currently works mainly for [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Currently affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).
